      • log

        public static void log(java.lang.String message,
                       java.lang.Object... messageArgs)
        A very crude logging mechanism, mainly for verifying or debugging the operation of real logging libraries. The message is written to org.domainobject.util.FileUtil.log in the temp directory as well as printed to standard out.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to append the message to
        message - The message to log
        See Also:
        #log(String, String, Object...)

      • log

        public static void log(java.io.File file,
                       java.lang.String message,
                       java.lang.Object... messageArgs)
        A very crude logging mechanism, mainly for verifying or debugging the operation of real logging libraries. The message argument will be prefixed with a newline, a timestamp and fed into String.format along with the messageArgs array.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to append the message to
        message - The message to log

      • delete

        public static void delete(java.lang.String path)
        Deletes the specified file. A RuntimeException will be thrown if the file could not be deleted.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the file
